intro: Myrmeconauclea strigosa var. fluviatilis, commonly known as the river holly, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It is a shrub or small tree with simple, opposite, and usually hairy leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers arranged in clusters, which are followed by woody, spiny fruits. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often near rivers or in dense forests. Its unique morphology and habitat make it an important species in its native ecosystems.
